Psalms__06.1: Unto the end, in verses, a psalm for David, <u>for the octave</u>.
Psalms__06.2: O Lord, rebuke me not in thy indignation, nor chastise me in thy wrath.
Psalms__06.3: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am weak: heal me, O Lord, for my bones are troubled.
Psalms__06.4: And my soul is troubled exceedingly: but thou, O Lord, how long?
Psalms__06.5: Turn to me, O Lord, and deliver my soul: O save me for thy mercy's sake.
Psalms__06.6: For there is no one in death, that is mindful of thee: and who shall confess to thee in hell?
Psalms__06.7: I have laboured in my groanings, every night I will wash my bed: I will water my couch with my tears.
Psalms__06.8: My eye is troubled through indignation: I have grown old amongst all my enemies.
Psalms__06.9: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity: for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping.
Psalms__06.10: The Lord hath heard my supplication: the Lord hath received my prayer.
Psalms__06.11: Let all my enemies be ashamed, and be very much troubled: let them be turned back, and be ashamed very speedily.
